page.title: 15The Manor of Michaelston
page.content: The origin of the manor is somewhat obscure, it was a sub_manor of the Lordship of Dinas Powys, being formed by grants made by the holders of the Knight's fees. Walter de Reigny was the first Lord of the manor of Michaelston to be recorded, about 1250_80. Although this is the first instance in which the manor appears, it formed part of the de Reigny estate and was united with Wrinstone, the manor house of which also served Michaelston for many years.The sub-manor of Michaelston was approximately the same extent as the parish of Michaelston-le-Pit.The manor passed through marriage to the Ralegh family of Nettlecombe Court in Somerset.Sir Simon de Ralegh made Wrinstone his principal seat and the Ralegh's were the first to erect a substantial manor house on or near
